snippet.title: Gene therapy gives full colour vision to colour-blind monkeys ...
snippet.description: Scientists have used gene therapy to give full colour vision to adult squirrel monkeys that had been colour-blind since birth, opening up a world of formerly invisible reds and oranges, right in fr...

snippet.title: How Light Wakes Up the Brain – Phenomena: Only Human
snippet.description: I first learned how our eyes work in a college neuroscience class in the fall of 2002. My textbook showed colorful cartoons of the retina, lined with two types of cells that convert light waves int...

snippet.title: Lasers-- " A Splendid Light " | National Geographic Magazine
My Own Light \- National Geographic Photo Contest 2011 ...
snippet.description: As a leader in capturing our world through brilliant imagery, National Geographic sets the standard for photographic excellence. This year's entrants did not disappoint—more than 20,000 photographs were submitted to the contest from over 130 countries, with professional and amateur photographers across the globe participating.

snippet.title: Europe's Horse Meat Scandal Casts Light on Food Taboo
snippet.description: Horse meat is at the heart of a United Kingdom scandal, but some cultures eat it regularly.
